fields.health_warning: GOVERNMENT WARNING: (1) ACCORDING TO THE SURGEON GENERAL, WOMEN SHOULD NOT DRINK ALCOHOLIC BEVERAGES DURING PREGNANCY BECAUSE OF THE RISK OF BIRTH DEFECTS. (2) CONSUMPTION OF ALCOHOLIC BEVERAGES IMPAIRS YOUR ABILITY TO DRIVE A CAR OR OPERATE MACHINERY, AND MAY CAUSE HEALTH PROBLEMS.

fieldDetails.reasoning: The producer/brand name appears at the top of the front label as 'DOMAINE JOURDAN'. This matches the product identifier and the provided product filename.
Back label shows the designation 'PRODUCT OF FRANCE; WHITE WINE' indicating the class/type as 'WHITE WINE'.
Back label lists the alcohol statement as 'ALCOHOL 13.5 % BY VOLUME' near the bottom of the panel.
Back label shows the bottle capacity as '750ML' immediately before the alcohol statement.

fieldDetails.value: GOVERNMENT WARNING: (1) ACCORDING TO THE SURGEON GENERAL, WOMEN SHOULD NOT DRINK ALCOHOLIC BEVERAGES DURING PREGNANCY BECAUSE OF THE RISK OF BIRTH DEFECTS. fieldDetails.reasoning: Back label contains the required federally mandated block beginning with 'GOVERNMENT WARNING:' followed by the two numbered statements; text is all-caps on the label.
Back label includes the bottler/producer identification 'ESTATE BOTTLED BY DOMAINE JOURDAN 37500 CRAVANT'. The name and town/postal appear as shown; qualifying phrase is extracted separately.
The back label uses the qualifying phrase 'ESTATE BOTTLED BY' immediately before the producer name.
Back label prose describes 'this Chenin Blanc is dry...' indicating the grape variety as Chenin Blanc.
Front label explicitly shows the appellation text 'APPELLATION CHINON CONTRÔLÉE' underneath the prominent 'CHINON' text.
The sulfite declaration 'CONTAINS SULFITES' appears on the back label within/adjacent to the government warning box.
The front label displays 'CROIX BOISSÉE' under the appellation; this is the vineyard/fanciful name used to identify the bottling.
Back label begins with 'PRODUCT OF FRANCE; WHITE WINE' indicating the country of origin as France.
Front label shows the vintage year '2021' under 'CROIX BOISSÉE'.
No explicit statement about standards of fill is visible on the provided label images.
